title: Moving charge - accelerated into E- and B-fields

content.question: A particle with charge <math alttext="q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>q</mi></math> and mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is accelerated from rest though a potential difference into a region where both a magnetic field <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> and an electric field <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math> are present. The electric and magnetic fields are such that the particle moves in a straight line at constant speed. What is the potential difference through which the particle was accelerated?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator m E, and denominator 2 q B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator m E squared, and denominator 2 q B squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi><msup><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator m B, and denominator 2 q E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator m B squared, and denominator 2 q E squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi><msup><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator m E squared, and denominator 2 q B squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><msup><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi><msup><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
